record.title: MEASURE READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2128
record.narrative:
MEASURE READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2128 -- (Senate - October 02, 2007)

[Page: S12450]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand that S. 2128 is at the desk, and I ask for its first reading.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 2128) to make the moratorium on Internet access taxes and multiple and discriminatory taxes on electronic commerce permanent.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now ask for a second reading, and in order to place the bill on the calendar under the provisions of rule XIV, I object to my own request.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bill will be read for the second time on the next legislative day.
